fastai.structured module¶

fastai.structured.add_datepart(df, fldname, drop=True)¶

add_datepart converts a column of df from a datetime64 to many columns containing the information from the date. This applies changes inplace.

fastai.structured.apply_cats(df, trn)¶

Changes any columns of strings in df into categorical variables using trn as a template for the category codes.

fastai.structured.combine_date(years, months=1, days=1, weeks=None, hours=None, minutes=None, seconds=None, milliseconds=None, microseconds=None, nanoseconds=None)¶
fastai.structured.draw_tree(t, df, size=10, ratio=0.6, precision=0)¶

Draws a representation of a random forest in IPython.

fastai.structured.fix_missing(df, col, name, na_dict)¶

Fill missing data in a column of df with the median, and add a {name}_na column which specifies if the data was missing.

fastai.structured.get_nn_mappers(df, cat_vars, contin_vars)¶
fastai.structured.get_sample(df, n)¶

Gets a random sample of n rows from df, without replacement.

fastai.structured.is_date(x)¶
fastai.structured.numericalize(df, col, name, max_n_cat)¶

Changes the column col from a categorical type to it’s integer codes.

fastai.structured.parallel_trees(m, fn, n_jobs=8)¶
fastai.structured.proc_df(df, y_fld, skip_flds=None, do_scale=False, na_dict=None, preproc_fn=None, max_n_cat=None, subset=None, mapper=None)¶

proc_df takes a data frame df and splits off the response variable, and changes the df into an entirely numeric dataframe.

fastai.structured.reset_rf_samples()¶

Undoes the changes produced by set_rf_samples.

fastai.structured.rf_feat_importance(m, df)¶
fastai.structured.scale_vars(df, mapper)¶
fastai.structured.set_plot_sizes(sml, med, big)¶
fastai.structured.set_rf_samples(n)¶

Changes Scikit learn’s random forests to give each tree a random sample of n random rows.

fastai.structured.train_cats(df)¶

Change any columns of strings in a panda’s dataframe to a column of catagorical values. This applies the changes inplace.
